availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Crenshaw Valentine (Warren County, Kentucky, carpenter)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, carpenter. Virginia native. Married to Eliza Y. Valentine. Father of Mary E. Valentine, John J. Valentine, Susan A. Valentine, Sarah J. Valentine, Samantha J. Valentine, Frances Valentine, William C. Valentine, James T. Valentine, and Eliza Valentine. Carpenter in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Master carpenter in Warren County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 122A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 425.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 845-46.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 438A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 80A.
"William Crenshaw Valentine (1814-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial #99589083, accessed September 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99589083.
